docs.title: TinyML: Efficient Machine Learning for Embedded AI Systems
docs.text:
(Danish Title) TinyML: Effektiv maskinlæring til indlejrede AI-systemer.

My way of creating an overview of a special course I am taking at The Technical University of Denmark as part of my MSc in Mathematical Modeling and Computation with a Machine Learning and Signal Processing specialization.

This page is created as a fork of the following course page Real-Time Visual and Machine Learning Systems. Thanks to Anders Bo Sørensen and his co-workers for making it available! Lightning icons created by Freepik - Flaticon .

docs.title: Learning Objectives
docs.text: A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:

docs.title: Evaluation
docs.text: • Summary report of the learnings throughout the course

docs.title: Course work
docs.text:
The course will consist of: * Lectures * Some readings (mainly papers) * Hands-on labs

For extra resources one may find the following useful: * Machine Learning Systems * Paper Overview - CMU On-Device Machine Learning

docs.title: Schedule
docs.text:
The course starts on Friday 7 June and runs until Friday 28 June 2024.

Date Labs Topics Lecture Efficient Inference 6/11/24 Lab 1 Pruning and Sparsity Part 1 , Part 2 6/12/24 Lab 2 Quantization Part 1, Part 2 6/13/24 Lab 3 Neural Architecture Search Part 1, Part 2 6/14/24 [Lab 4][24] Knowledge Distillation Link 6/15/24 [Lab 5][25] Frameworks MCUNet, TinyEngine Domain Specific Optimization 6/17/24 Lab 6 and Lab 7 Transformer and LLM Part 1, Part 2 6/18/24 Lab 8 Vision Transformer Link 6/19/24 GAN, Video, and Point Cloud Link 6/20/24 Diffusion Model Link 6/21/24 Recurrent Neural Networks Paper Efficient Training 6/24/24 Distributed Training Part 1, Part 2 6/25/24 On-Device Training and Transfer Learning Link 6/26/24 Efficient Fine-tuning and Prompt Engineering Link 6/27/24 Lab 14 Benchmarking TinyML Systems Paper 6/28/24 Lab 15 Carbon and Energy Tracking Paper
